comment.text:
I can't believe I haven't had Ruby Chow's in 5 years of living in Atlanta! It's right down the street from Ponce so I was always scared of parking. Luckily, I was able to find street parking across the street (Glen Iris).

This place is deceiving from the outside, but don't let that fool you. The service, food and drinks were absolutely tasty. 

The restaurant is quite small, but does have a bar. Service was overall great. After ordering, it felt like every dish came out within minutes. 

I would totally come back here for the scallops alone! nom nom

A warm yet inviting & upscale Asian fusion restaurant, with a super friendly atmosphere & stylish Oriental decor. The seating options vary from the main dining area with booths & tables to the spacious bar & private dining upstairs. 

We didn't have reservations yet were able to sit at the bar. Kevin, our Bartender/Server extended us such amazing & engaging service during our first visit here. All the staff we encountered offered the same welcoming service. 

The food menu offers shareable selections providing a great way to try different dishes.

The Vegan options are plenty (about 6-7 offerings) - I had an order of Spring Rolls to hold me over. My Brother had the Basil Chicken in a garlic & lightly sweet sauce & puff rice. 

The curated menu of libations includes unique cocktails & a few high-quality wines & beers. They offer Half-off Bottle of Wines on Mondays. Overall the menus had a flexible price point, especially for a small party of 2-3. 

Reservations are limited to 90 minutes & the patio tables are limited to 2-4 guests. Street parking or Valet for $5 which is located in the parking garage next door.

*Service: 5/5
*Menu: 4/5 
*Taste: 4/5
*Portion: 5/5
*Price: 4/5
*Atmosphere: 5/5
*Overall Experience: 5/5

photos.caption: Port Of Tokyo II - Japanese Whiskey, Shiso Syrup, Port, & Bitters, 12.06.2023.
Swan Song - Vodka, Elderflower Liqueur, White Bordeaux, 12.06.2023.
One of many fengshui lighting fixtures, 12.06.2023.
Basil Chicken - Thai basil, garlic, onions & puff rice, 12.06.2023.
Vegan options that Ayana (Bartender) took the time out to mark up for me, 12.06.2023.

comment.text:
I liked this place a lot! I came here on a rainy Friday night with my friends who are local and it took us a minute to find the door... We walked past it 3 times - it was very non-descript. 

We were seated upstairs and our server grabbed our drink orders. I was starving so obviously I wanted to order the whole menu. Service was a tad slow as our server was serving both upstairs and down. 

I started with a mocktail- The Butterfly effect and that was delicious. I tried the Cranberry boss and hated that. It was awful. My friend got a few cocktails and enjoyed his. 

For food:
Peking duck buns - good! The bun was soft and the duck was cooked well. Didn't have skin though. 
Miso soup - meh - don't get this
Seared scallops - Scallops were decent sized. Overly salty 
Roasted bone marrow - I LOVE bone marrow and this was delicious
Salt and pepper tofu - mid
Miso eggplant dip - my friend's favorite of the night
Roti canai - soft roti with dip, very good
Shoyu tomago - it was okay? 
Cacio pepe - I did not like this but my friend did 
Pork Kimchi Fried Rice - I liked it but it came out so late that I didn't have stomach for it anymore
Green beans - SO good. I ate it all within 2 minutes of it being put down 
Mango sticky rice - I love mango sticky rice, but I really don't like it when they put mango sorbet on top vs fresh mango. Did not like. 
Panna cotta

I think prices are pretty okay and I definitely enjoyed my meal!

I thought Ruby Chow's was such an unexpected gem, it's sort of unassuming from the outside but has some speakeasy vibes inside. We didn't have a reservation, but were able to snag seats at the bar. The bartender was so sweet, and I thought the drinks were delicious. For food we got the scallops, shishito peppers, bone marrow, and pork kimchi rice. Truly everything was so flavorful and perfectly done.

I've heard nothing but good things about Ruby Chow's and I was finally able to stop by. We didn't have a reservation, but got there not too long after they opened. We were able to be seated right away at the bar. The bartender was very pleasant and attentive. We ordered drinks and food, everything came out fairly quickly. My favorite item was probably the Peking Duck bun. Everything else was good as well: wontons, basil chicken, mussels, scallops.
Awesome food and drinks. I also really like the aesthetic inside. Parking was not difficult.

The food was incredible and the ambiance was so unique and cool. I want to go back and try everything else because everything we ordered was delicious. Service was also great, and they provided great suggestions.

photos.caption: Away on holiday and swan song

comment.text:
This restaurant has valet for only five dollars so you do not have to circle the block attempting to find a parking space. When you walk towards the restaurant after parking, you will notice beautiful Chinese paper lanterns and the outdoor eating area. The moment you walk through the blue door you will feel enchanted by the long velvet drapes and the warm pink lighting. The host was extremely kind and welcoming and I was seated right away. 

I think I was matched with the best waitress on their staff, Ashley. She was so knowledgeable about the menu items and described them accurately. The service is exceptional and the food is mouth watering and delicious. Every single dish I ate I literally closed my eyes and sighed because it was just that good. The squash soup is like a warm autumn hug and the roti canai had the right amount of spicy notes. The roti arrives warm, buttery with a slight crisp and pairs well with the red curry chicken and potatoes.  Every dish is shareable and the portions allow you to select multiple dishes before feeling too full.  This restaurant is a gem and is now going to be placed on my top ten list. The entire experience was phenomenal, so don't sleep on this place make reservations right away because space is limited.

I really really like this upscale Asian fusion restaurant. It is perfect for an intimate date night out. The ambiance is very intimate and posh, with very tasteful oriental decor. The drinks were good, they have a curated selection of unique cocktails. We got a couple drinks that were pretty good, kind of strong.

For the food, they do sharable style where you can order small plates. You are able to order a variety of dishes to try, and the prices are very reasonable for 2 people. We got the tamago, cacio e pepe, brussel sprouts, miso eggplant dip, and basil chicken. Really impressed with the tamago egg dish. It has really good flavor and good texture with the crispy rice. Our two other favorites were the basil chicken and the cacio e pepe. The basil chicken had a nice crispy texture on the chicken while still flavorful with basil and onion. The consistency of the cacio e pepe noodles were fantastic and chewy, it reminded me of Italy.

Lastly we had the Panna Cotta dessert. The yuzu flavor on top really adds a nice tart flavor to the vanilla cream base.

I really really recommend this place for a date night!

Okkk...I'm definitely hooked on this place. I recently moved back to Atlanta and I visited this restaurant two times in one week. I had the scallops and Pepe pasta. This will be my go to moving forward. Soo much flavor omg. 

The service is phenomenal as always. Mark the manager was amazing and our server, Renee was great.

The cutest Asian inspired restaurant. Tucked into old fourth ward across from Ponce market you'd barely notice they're there but once you're inside you're captivated by the decor and smells! We did not have a reservation which we lucked and were able to be seated in 20 min. The service was stellar, drinks were good, food was fresh and full of flavor. The pork cutlet and Cacio Pepe is a MUST Try. I still dream about it! You won't regret making this spot your next date night stop!

I sat at the bar and enjoyed a few drinks along with several dishes. The bartender was knowledgeable, attentive, and fast. 

For food, I shared pow pow shrimp which was nicely battered and had a pleasant lemongrass taste, the sake butter mussels (you get a good amount of mussels and the broth is delicious), basil chicken (always my favorite dish to try), shoyu tamago with caviar (I'd recommend not getting it with caviar since the delicious sweet soy vinaigrette it comes with overpowers the caviar), and the confit chicken which was tender and came with a delicious purée. 

I would definitely recommend coming here to try a few, or a lot, of the dishes!

photos.caption: Basil chicken (you get more but was started to dig in. My favorite dish)
Shoyu tamago with caviar (recommend not getting the caviar since the delicious sweet soy vinaigrette overpowers it)

comment.text: Came in on a Friday night. I couldn't figure out where to park even though there's a big sign on the building for Ruby Chow's that says parking. After circling the block a couple times a spot opened up on the street a few feet from the entrance. I was also a bit confused on where the front door was because there wasn't a sign like there is on the side that says to go around to the other door. Felt very speakeasy-ish. There looked to be an upstairs but I don't think they were allowing people up there. The downstairs is fairly small but the stylish Oriental decor was very cute and the roar of conversations gave good energy. We were initially sat at a 2 seater table but their tables are too close together for my taste so we sat at the bar. The bartender Ayana (spelling??) was so cool and friendly. We wanted to try a bunch of things since there are several shareable options lol but we settled on the duck and pork steamed buns, the kimchi pork fried rice and the Shaking beef. All were so delicious. Out of the duck and pork steamed buns I liked the pork the most. It reminds me of a pork schnitzel. The fried rice was one of the best I've ever had and the shaking beef was very tender and flavorful. Decent prices for 2 people I think. The manager walked around greeting people. I forgot his name but he was so welcoming and accommodating to us.  I'll be spreading the word about this spot!!

On our second visit to Ruby Chow's we ordered the Pow Pow Shrimp, Lion's Head Meatballs, Pork Belly & Grits, Szechuan Green Beans, Spicy Pork Noodle, "Cacio e Pepe," Spicy Wonton Dumplings, and the Mango Sticky Rice. In addition to our regular favorites (Pork Belly & Grits and Mango Sticky Rice), we loved the Pow Pow Shrimp -- a perfect balance of tangy, sweet, crispy, and savory!

photos.caption: Pow Pow Shrimp, Green Beans, Pork Belly & Grits

comment.text:
Ruby Chow's is truly a shining gem in a sea of over-priced and often overrated restaurants. The ambience, the service, and the food...all top tier!! My friend and I visited on an early Wednesday evening. We did have reservations, which I highly recommend, as it gets pretty busy and the place is small. 
This place specializes in Asian Fusion (mostly Thai and Chinese) cuisine and serves dishes tapas style. My friend and I ordered about 6 dishes to share, which were were all amazing! While I didn't get pictures of everything, I most remember the duck bao buns, garlic green beans, and walnut shrimp. I absolutely cannot wait to try more dishes when I return!

photos.caption: I can't recall the name of this drink, but I was delicious! Perfectly light, fruity, and fresh.

comment.text: Food is delicious, ambiance is 10/10. Very cozy yet trendy inside. Service is great, very friendly staff! Love this neighborhood spot!

What a hidden treat! 

Ambiance: charming, eclectic, cozy. There is a covered patio and an upstairs nook. 

Service: happy, kind, attentive. They really believe in the product!

Food: the real star yall. 
Miso soup: standard, classic, but can't go wrong 
Green beans: incredibly flavorful, crunchy, and huge portion to share 

Cacio e pepe: unique experience with ramen noodles, very creamy and rich. Not very soupy. Worth sharing. 

Shoyu tomago: flavor flavor texture texture!
Pow pow shrimp: smaller portion but the taste is worth it

Salt and pepper tofu: yall, talk about five spice. This was crunchy, sweet, umami deliciousness with a kick. 

Kimchi rice: a huge portion and huge kick of flavor. 
I would order all of these items again, but I would want to try more. 

Price: menu ranges tapa style from $6-$17; honestly for the price and portion it aligns well with Asian fusion elevated equivalents. 

Parking: be advised there is a valet on the back side of the complex and it's approx the same price as self park. Just add extra time if needed. 

Overall I will be back!

(Please excuse my terrible pictures!)

Ruby Chow's was a really fun birthday dinner! It was a nice night out without being too overly pricey. We were upstairs which was cute but I wish I could've seen the whole place.

My fiancée and I both loved our mocktails. We ordered a variety of dishes, including the cacio and Pepe noodles, Brussels sprouts, duck bun, miso soup, pork belly & grits, and roti canai. This was plenty to get us full, I would recommend maybe 2-3 plates per person. We also shared mango sticky rice which left us SO full. We wish we would have had a bit more guidance on the ordering.

Everything was really good, but took a while. My favorite was the pork belly, or maybe the brussels sprouts. The service was good but perhaps not exquisite. We did valet parking.

Ruby Chow's was a recommendation from someone in Atlanta and after reading the reviews... I had to try
They only had outdoor seating(even with a reservation) it was a bit chilly but the heaters, the AFTER HOURS (Hennessy,Benedictine, Rye Whiskey, Orange Bitter) cocktail and my engaging waitress..the evening became enchanting.  
This is a tapas style restaurant ...so try everything 
I'll be back to dine inside...cool vibes

photos.caption: After Hours ... like an old fashioned... good

comment.text:
GREAT FOOD + AMBIANCE

A perfect spot for a date. Dimmed lighting + red decor in a really cool smaller spot in the old fourth ward. 

Make sure to use the valet parking in the garage behind and to the left of the restaurant for the most convenient way to park. Valet is $5 and they take cash, card or venmo. 

This Asian fusion spot was amazing -- basil chicken was an absolute favorite along with the Cacio e Pepe not pictured. The drinks were great too, but ask for light ice.

Loved this place! In all of my almost 10 years of being in Atlanta off/on, I'd never heard of it. I was so used to being at City Winery across the street. 

My date took me here after a concert. We arrived 45 mins early & tried to get a table. There was a wait. We weren't bothered. The staff offered us menus & beverages. Very attentive. 

Small plates to share - yes please. You'd assume the portions are too little, but you'll get FULL very quickly. We had the Pork belly & grits, Green Beans, Wonton, Roti w/ chicken, Peking beef (Togo) & Mango sticky rice. My food was so good that I ordered more green beans togo. Also, my server suggested a great Passionfruit limeade as I'm pregnant & can't drink alcohol. 

I do not know the price point. Didn't pay! 

I'd absolutely eat here again! 
Thanks Sheri (server) you were great.

photos.caption: Pork Belly & Grits Green Beans  Roti w/ Chicken

comment.text:
Ruby Chow's is an excellent spot for 2nd dates, close friends, and small savory dishes. 
It's a fusion tapas-style restaurant mixing Asian, Italian, and American flavors with a variety of zero proof drinks.

The most difficult thing to do here is choose what not to get. Everything has satisfying flavors that make you want to continue eating forever: crunchy rolls, savory noodles, flaky flatbreads, and rich creamy soups. Umami flavor is center stage here. The Cacio E Pepe was a standout dish and one of the best examples of the benefits you can achieve by mixing culinary cultures. 

If you are interested in tasting thoughtful zero proof drinks, this is the place for you. They offer a wide selection of specialty drinks that are fruity and herbal.

The layout of this restaurant is very unique. You walk in through velvet curtains and you already feel somewhere special. It is dimly lit with a regal ruby color palette. There is a cozy upstairs section as well. If you are looking to dine outdoors, there are heaters and beautiful Chinese lanterns hanging above you. At night, this is quite a sight. 

Located close to PCM, you can park on nearby streets or in the adjacent parking deck. It's a very lively area. I would recommend reservations here unless you get there when they open.

At the end, the bill was served with a delicious frozen grape and a beautiful flower centerpiece. It was the happiest bill I've ever received! I would come back here many times again.

photos.caption: Crispy rolls - you can specify which sauce you would like. Very crunch and satisfying. One person can eat both of these if they are hungry
Walnut shrimp was light and crispy. Excellent if you love walnuts. Walnut were whole, not chopped up and integrated into the dish.
"Cacio E Pepe" is better than the original!
Roti Canai with Malaysian curry. I was pleasantly surprised to see Malaysian food here. Make sure to order an extra Roti!
The beautiful bill. It was like a reward or something...

comment.text: For the ambience service and flavor profile the food I thought that this restaurant was excellent in value. I was a little bit worried when I first got there thinking that it would be really expensive. But it ended up being a great experience overall --definitely would return back.

We came here for a friends birthday there was about 20 of us. I was little skeptical about coming. My expectations were low due to it being an upscale Chinese restaurant but boy ol boy, let me tell you ..... it BLEW MY MIND!! 

My friend made reservations and we were seated somewhat in a private area upstairs. It was a very cute place, soft music, low lighting, perfect atmosphere and the staffs were wonderful!! Definitely a Great place for date night. 

Mind you I already had low expectations coming here so I didn't care to look up the menu before coming... it's Tapas style menu and none of didn't know what to order so we all started on drinks first. After a few shots in the birthday girl said to the waiter, " we would like two orders of every thing please "  

The food came out pretty quick. The first thing that came out was the roasted bone marrow and let me tell you, my low expectations change so quick!!! That bone marrow was sooooo delicious!!! I was so excited to try the rest of the dishes. I didn't get to take a picture of all the food but I sure will tell you that EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD!!! Taught me real quick to not judge a book by it cover.

Wow! I love Ruby Chow's and the whole vibe. Everything I have eaten here is delicious. I was a little disappointed I never got to try the vegan general tso's since last time it was out of stock and this time, it was replaced with salt and pepper tofu. The salt and pepper tofu was delicious though and I highly recommend it. 

I started with the soft shell crab bao, which is a must. My friend and I shared the salt and pepper tofu, Brussels sprouts, and rice and made a yummy little bowl! The sauce on the Brussels sprouts is so yummy.

Incredible establishment - from food, to the finely crafted cocktails, to the gorgeous ambiance and finally a wonderful staff that makes you feel SO welcome. 
Ruby Chow's is everything I look for in a restaurant! I recommend literally anything off the menu, and the Lavender cocktail. Great spot for a date or girl's night.

The ambiance was very relaxed as expected. Our server was nice and offered some great mocktail recommendations. Food came out fast but was not overwhelming despite the amount we ordered. Everything we ordered was delicious. The standout dish was the cacaio e pepe. You should always add the pork cutlet. The roti was a close second. This is a must visit spot for anyone who lives here or is just visiting

photos.caption: Cacaio e Pepe with Pork cutlet
Cacaio e pepe with pork cutlet

comment.text:
Lissen ! This food was soooo good ! We had Buns katsu) I have never had buns before they were delicious  we tried the shaking beef ! It was bussin ! 
The spring roll situation we order twice they were so delightful ! This spot is dope for before the show "city winery" out waitress was so engaging Renee' made the night !!! And the vibe was so Retro chic I couldn't stop taking pictures ! I feel like I'm in the it crowd now after going ! Drinks were good too !

photos.caption: The check !  Came like this How cute
This little waterfall outside of the patio was very zen !
The plastic covered seats gave us such a cool retro vibe !
Transformed to china town right here ! What fun
Star of the show ! Dragon heart!!!

comment.text:
Service is exceptional. We had the pork kimchi rice and the roti canai and were fighting eachother to eat more. Seriously could not get enough! Delicious! Atmosphere is unique and inviting too, good lighting and music. Gotta grab that mango sticky rice for dessert. 
New favorite restaurant!!!!

What's interesting is I normally LOVE this place, but we had a weird experience recently. It was the first time in my entire life I'd been asked to leave a restaurant because a party was waiting (there were empty tables nearby). We weren't asked to transition to the bar area - just leave. "sorry friends, but we have some guests waiting for this table..." Interestingly, one of the folks in our party left an item at the table and had to go inside to get it a few minutes later. Of course, there were no guests seated or waiting LOL. When I called the manager he stood by the employee and swore people were waiting to be seated there. It was very odd. Service is significantly better at the bar. Food is good and prices are reasonable, but plates are small (enough to share with one other person).

Such a cute place! I remember when this space was a sushi restaurant but it looks nothing like it did before, kudos on the interior design! This is a great spot for a date or for a girl's night. The restaurant is intimately  dimmed and romantic. I took my bestie here for her bday. 

Now the food. So many yummy tapa dishes to choose from, and our waiter did a superb job describing the dishes. It was a tough decision but we went with the pork belly fried rice, bone marrow, green beans and the walnut shrimp. My friend also had the miso soup. Everything was so tasty! My first time having bone marrow and it was super buttery and flavorful but one of the ends of the larger bones was red which looked a little raw so we didn't eat that part. 

The bartender was amazing! Craft cocktails only here, we had lavender margaritas and they were a hit! Nicely balanced. 

Bathrooms were clean, service was great. Parking is available in the parking deck, I think it was $5. 

I will definitely be back!!!

Amazing ambiance, service was great too, the food tasted very good!!
My favorite was the roti it's a must try

photos.caption: Got the chicken curry n roti, the egg n rice(forgot name), tofu, and bao bun

comment.text: I was expecting Ruby Chow's to be a casual chinese takeout restaurant and was pleasantly surprised when I walked inside and saw a beautiful interior and really unique menu options! Had I known that the restaurant itself would be so pretty I would have eaten in instead of ordering takeout! Regardless, the food was really good -- I got the roti canal which I absolutely loved and would get over and over again. I also got the spicy pork noodle which was an interesting fusion of asian and italian noodles with the pork ragu. Some other doses on the menu looked very exciting so I am definitely going back here one day to try out some new things!

This place is such a cute gem in ATL's O4W neighborhood. Cute Asian restaurant that specializes in small plates & intimate dining. 

Parking: $3 validated valet parking

Food: Amazing. We enjoyed the Garlic Noodles, General Tso's Chicken & both Shrimp offerings. The Walnut Shrimp was the highlight of them all. Think Bang Bang shrimp. The portions are small since they are small plates so keep this in mind.

Drinks: The margarita was tasty, but a little too sweet for me. I ended up ordering the After Hours cocktail, which was like an old fashioned & very good.

Service: Very attentive, friendly service from all the staff I encountered. Our waitress was so sweet & gave us a complimentary new ice cream for my partner's birthday.

Overall, this was a great experience. I'm looking forward to visiting in the colder months. I hear they offer outdoor seating in Igloos!

photos.caption: Garlic Noodles aka Caico E Pepe

comment.text:
Ruby Chow's has to be one of the more unique places j have tried recently that was also amazing! We walked in as a party of 3 on Saturday night and we definitely should have made reservations. We were able to luckily get a seat at the bar. 

We sat down and ordered drinks. I got the cocktail with the empress gin and it was tasty! For the mains, we got a bunch of different options and they were all amazing! The dumplings were delicious and one of my faves and have to admit the cacio e pepe pasta was delicious. This is for sure a unique menu and everything is delicious. The vibes of this restaurant are great to and I look forward to going back reservations and trying some of their main entrees versus the tapas style. Great job to Ruby Chow's and a great recommendation!

The restaurant has a very retro 80s decoration ! The hostess was a hoot and very friendly ! The waitress was super friendly 
Drinks were okay ( lychee martini and mezcal aperol drink). The food was Asian fusion and we ordered scallops ( okay), fried oysters good) basil chicken ( v good), green beans and mixed greens but the hands down winner was Brussels sprouts. Mango sticky rice was a bit disappointing.

Went to celebrate a friend's birthday. I was confused by the parking situation. Parked at Ponce City Market. But apparently, they have valet but unsure where it is. But they validate. 

The decor was cute and had a great vibe.   The menu was limited for me just because I prefer chicken and I only eat white meat. All the chicken dishes are thigh meat. I was disappointed. However, the drinks were good and the house salad was amazing. I ordered the corn soup. It was tasty but I don't like the consistency. It was more of a purée.

Wow, this restaurant is awesome! So happy I finally had a chance to try out this place with a few friends. 

First, they do have valet parking located behind the restaurant and it's $5.00. No need to stress about Peking on the street or over at Ponce City Market.

Upon arriving, as you walk by their outdoor seating and walk through the entrance doors you are transported to a very cool 70s/80s Asian lounge complete with old school Chinese mats with the Chinese Zodiac.

The menu is interesting and has a fusion of many Asian dishes...Chinese, Thai, Indian, etc and even Italian! We decided as a group to try all of their buns (duck, pork and soft shelled crab) and each one of us select two small plates to share. In the end we got: kimchi fried rice, green beans, wontons, bang bang shrimp, shaking beef, fried oysters, roti canai, basil chicken, chicken confit, crispy rolls, salt and pepper tofu. All of it was tasty...you seriously cannot go wrong with anything in the menu!

For dessert we got the mango sticky rice and the chocolate pot au crème which were just ok.

We left happy, full and wanting to come back again! Can't say that about most places! Highly recommend if you haven't had the chance!

Man I love this place !!! Not only is the food amazing but the service is one of the best. Really great spot to catch-up with a friend or grab some food after a long at work. The mango sticky rice is a must try

Ambiance 5/5 - it's beautiful inside! sexy, colorful, feels upscale and sophisticated and you won't feel crazy if you always overdress how I do. The velvet seats and the art work at a little extra something that really makes you forget you're on Ponce Ave. 
Parking: Pull into the parking lot and use the valet service. Ruby Chow does validate it, but it only takes a few $ off. I hate paying for parking and think it's an abomination but this is the only part of the night I didn't enjoy, so I'm not really trippinggggg. 
Service: Our waitress was very attentive. She knew the menu inside and out, was able to recommend/not recommend things to us and even encouraged us to order less (because we were being greedy lol). Food came out fresh, beautifully plates and quck!
Food: I met a friend here and we shared everything. We got: 
Peking dduck buns: dduck is one of my fav things to eat and this buns did not dissappint. The bun itseld was chewy, soft and fluffy (sinks into your teeth) and the cucumber, hoisin and star anise jus was the perfect accompaniment to the fatty dduck (why won't my keyboard let me type dduck without automatically replacing the "d" for an "f?!" do i really cuss that much? I guess the proof is in the keyboard auto correct pudding. 
Walnut shrimp: delightful! Creamy, savory, umami packed and the shrimp was buttery and soft. Wasn't spicy at all to me, though. 
Brussel sprouts: the puffed rice went really well with the spouts and puree. They were really well seasoned, not bitter and the perfect amount of crisp. 
Shoyu Tomago: The star of the show. I would have eaten 12 of these if I could. The most delicious, sexy, beautiful egg I've ever consumed. The rice cake really took it up three notches. I would go back again JUST to get this egg. 
Szechuan Green beans: one of my fav ways to eat green beans and this did not disappoint. Perfect amount of crispy/char and the sweet glaze was a nice compliment to the salty. 
Salt and pepper tofu: I get this at any restaurant that has it on the menu and this is by far one of the best I've had in the atlanta area. 
Cacio & Pepe: Not what I was expecting but in a good way. It was SO good. The szechuan gave it a nice layered profile. Wish it was more spicy but I tend to have an insatiable spice meter so maybe I'm the toxic one here. 
Dessert: We got the chocolate thingy with miso. Chocolate, sesame and miso is an undefeated mix and it hit every taste bud there is to hit. Really satisfying and comforting way to end a meal. 

The cocktails are delightful and very sexy - from the ingredients to the presentation. I got a mocktail with lychee. It was refreshing and perfect for the summer heat. 

 I will absolutely be back!

This might be my favorite restaurant I've tried recently in Atlanta!! My friends and I walked in on a Saturday evening for dinner before a concert. We were able to get seated at the bar since it was just 3 of us but you DEFINITELY should get reservations. Parking also is a little tricky - you'll need to park in a Parkmobile zone, Ponce City Market and walk, or residential and walk. 

Service was excellent, everything came really fast like within 5-10 minutes of ordering! We got the Basil Chicken, Cacio E Pepe, Dumplings, Pow Pow Shrimp, and Fried Oysters. I also had the GBS (Ginger-Bourbon Sour). My drink was so tasty and just the right amount of ginger to play off the bourbon. The food was also incredibly tasty, we liked every single dish!! I think the pow pow shrimp, dumplings, and cacio e pepe has to be my favorite. There was plenty of food and we were able to finish dinner so quickly and be on time for our concert!

Overall, 10/10 recommend Ruby Chows, especially for a nice dinner (make sure to get reservations)!

I heard so many good things about this place and ended up being so disappointed. Loved the inside decor and ambiance. Sat at bar with date to eat dinner. It took a long time to get a drink and our food simply was not good. I only had a few bites and didn't even want to order something else because of the taste. Maybe I'll give it a try again one day . It's my favorite cuisine so was hopeful to have another go to spot in Atlanta.

Reservation was easy to make. Walking into the restaurant felt very blissful with the attractive asian fusion theme.
Service was excellent, and the server was knowledgeable in making recommendations based on our diet restrictions.
The server was very accommodating in ensuring our food was meeting our expectations.
Every cuisine we ordered was delicious. The best was the bone marrow and shrimp
They have valet parking for $3
The only reason I have a 4 star was due to the additional charges to order more bread. Rarely seen that at restaurants.

3 stars - Good

I would describe Ruby Chow's as "Chinese-style tapas." Came across this restaurant through Googling "Eater Atlanta", as they usually have pretty good recommendations. 

Between the two of us, we ordered 
- duck bao (dry)
- katsu bao (juicy; would recommend over the duck)
- bone barrow (the best thing we ordered)
- walnut shrimp (not as sweet as I'm used to, more on the salty side)
- shishito peppers (wish there were more than 6-7 pieces)
- shoyu tamago (egg was cooked well, similar to ramen soft texture. crispy rice was crispy and not hard.)
- panna cotta (delicious!)
- mango sticky rice (mango sorbet was delicious, sticky rice was on the mushier side, mangoes not the ripest)

The food came out around the same time and hot. Our waitress checked up on us often enough and was friendly. The vibe in the restaurant is moody with Asian-floral-inspired wallpaper. Bar was lively! 

(If you are coming from the Bay Area or grew up with abundance of Chinese/Asian-fusion food, I would recommend trying more local-Atlanta food).

Unassuming from the outside, when you enter Ruby Chow's, you're welcomed by swanky and lush interiors with East Asian touches. This is one of those rare places that I'm enthralled by the entire menu, there's nothing that  disappoints. The Roasted Bone Marrow delivers flavor and depth, while the pork Katsu marries the cheesy Cacio E Pepe with a fried pork cutlet, and it's divine. Each menu item comes in a generous portion and is easy to share between 2 - 3 people. The atmosphere, the food, and the hip outdoor seating area crowns Ruby Chow's as queen of the city!
I got the basil chicken it was delicious and came in a hot skillet. I sat at the bar and the vibes were great it was crowded but everything still came out really quickly.

This was actually amazing, in my boyfriends words, "one of the best restaurants I've discovered!" We had the katsu buns, wontons, spicy pork noodles, roti canai, pow pow shrimp, soi cowboy drink. Our waitress was so nice and the inside of the restaurant was so cool, especially the downstairs. 

All were amazing but we definitely loved the katsu buns and wontons the most! Loved the Asian tapas style of this restaurant and will definitely be back! New favorite spot for sure!

Really really cute restaurant. Interior is so unique and really creates an elevated experience. The food is very solid, a little hard to choose for someone picky, like myself. Our waitress was so sweet and even chased after us outside when we forgot our leftovers. For two people, got four dishes. Chengdu Brussel Sprouts were phenomenal, had so much flavor. I wasn't the biggest fan of the spicy pork noodle, the fusion of italian and asian threw me off a little. Shaking Beef had really good texture and flavor, definitely one of the smaller dishes. My least favorite dish was the Basil Chicken. It had a kind of minty/licorice after-taste that I did not particularly like.

Overall, a really nice place to go to with a great staff and atmosphere. Food was good but wouldn't suggest for you if you're pickier. 

I'd still come back, for sure!

I visited Ruby Chow's for dinner on a Friday night and had a good experience. We really enjoyed some of our plates and had friendly service service, so I'd definitely visit again to explore more of the menu.

Some of our plates were exciting and delicious, and others were just okay, but nothing was bad. My favorite dishes were the Chengdu Brussels sprouts and the katsu bun. The Brussels sprouts were a good level of crispness and had excellent sauces and seasonings throughout; the plate comes with a generous portion that we enjoyed throughout the meal. The katsu bun is soft on the outside and crispy and saucy on the inside with the perfect level of spice. In my opinion, our other dishes (the wontons, pork belly & grits, duck bun, and panna cotta) were just okay; they were well-prepped but didn't taste as flavorful or interesting. I enjoyed being able to share and sample a variety of small plates, and the food seemed appropriately priced.

We had good service throughout the meal. The hostess and our server were both very friendly and welcoming. The server gave direct and honest recommendations (which turned out to be on-point) which we really appreciated. We dined outside since I secured the reservation only ~24hrs in advance and that was the only space available. It was definitely a cold night so we wore out jackets most of the time, but they had heaters by the cluster of outdoor tables which helped. The outdoor space is covered overhead, so I imagine it's fine in the rain as well, but I'd recommend trying to get a table indoors if it's a particularly cold night.
Fun restaurant with good food and cute cocktails. How can you not love a place called Ruby Chow's?
